intro: Acranthera simalurensis, commonly known as the Simalurensis starflower, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant is herbaceous, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found growing along forest floors or in understory habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
